name: Neill's Self Raising Soda Bread Flour 3Kg
usage: <Cooking_Instructions><Preparation_and_Usage>Neill's Flour RangeSee pack for full usage instructions.</Preparation_and_Usage><Recipes>Fruit Soda BreadIngredients475g Neill's Soda Bread Flour65g Sugar, Granulated1 tsp Salt1 Medium Egg, Lightly Beaten450ml Buttermilk110g Dried Sultanas or RaisinsMethod1. Preheat oven to 160Â°C / Gas Mark 3.2. Grease a 2lb loaf tin.3. Combine the flour, sugar, dried fruit and salt. Blend the egg and buttermilk together, and add all at once to the flour mixture.4. Pour into the prepared bread tin.5. Cut a slice half way through the dough as this will help the bread to rise evenly and flour the top of the dough.6. Bake for approximately one hour or until a skewer inserted into the bread comes out clean.7. The base of the loaf should sound hollow when you tap it. Turn on to a wire rack to cool.Makes 1x2lb loaf, Time: 75 mins</Recipes></Cooking_Instructions>
